channel.title: About Reines's RSCD
channel.description:
Hi, I've always been wondering one thing. Back when Reines hosted original RSCDaemon, then how secure was it? Were dupes common?(since in v4 and neither in v25 there are many of the simplest dupes unfixed) How stabile was it? Was the version later released by PR4Y the exact same version Reines used? Why Reines decided to stop?
These are the questions I'd like to be answered, thanks in advance.

item.title: About Reines's RSCD
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

MubbY-Donskiie:

Trading/Dueling yourself was fixed in RSCDaemon, I believe PR4Y made it able to Trade/Duel yourself in his release, I mean this is just a guess but Demonik had it fixed so why wouldn’t RSCD? Just a guess though.

Because demonik wasn’t ran by Jamie. In the same way that things RSCDv25 didn’t have, have been added to servers, ran by people such as Luke or xEnt.

Read full topic

item.title: About Reines's RSCD
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

correct Ecko, however Rick was still in RSCD when it was released, if it’s not in the same location then PR4Y obviously moved him around when preparing for midievo when never happened.

Read full topic

item.title: About Reines's RSCD
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

I can recall alot more npcs which are not in the rscdv25 source.

Read full topic

item.title: About Reines's RSCD
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote author=Ecko link=topic=456944.msg3344840#msg3344840 date=1284762189]Well for starters there was the NPC Rick, which was not in MidiEvo or anything PR4Y had (Kryptix renamed him to Luke in RSCE like a fag). I’m pretty sure PR4Y had the latest client but not the latest server build.

There was no NPC called Rick? In fact there was no custom NPC what-so-ever as far as I can remember… If we had the latest client build the NPC would be in the client cache don’t remember. I’m not sure where you got that I renamed a NPC to Luke either?[/quote]
Yes, there was. The NPC is called Luke IIRC on RSCE and is located in Seers. He certs flax and bow strings. He was named after a player on RSCDaemon (Rick) who was a high level woodcutter or fletcher. I know there’s an NPC on your server that certs flax and bow strings, but is at different coords than the one Reines implemented in RSCDaemon.

Read full topic

item.title: About Reines's RSCD
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:5, topic:360634”][quote author=Old Rsc Player link=topic=456944.msg3344545#msg3344545 date=1284739362]

I believe your wrong about PR4Y releasing the exact copy that was run. There was alot more to RSCDaemon which you dont see in the released source.

its the same one, tell me what was on RSCD that wasn’t released?

Well im not talking about anything spectacular, things such as objectactionhandlers and npcscripts…
[/quote]
i’m very certain it was exactly the same one, i played a lot of RSCD and never saw anything different compared to the released one.[/quote]
Well for starters there was the NPC Rick, which was not in MidiEvo or anything PR4Y had (Kryptix renamed him to Luke in RSCE like a fag). I’m pretty sure PR4Y had the latest client but not the latest server build.

Read full topic
